question: [File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [Struct: StateValuesWithProofRequest] [Proof Version Mismatch] Is there validation that the version field matches the version of the state values being requested, or can mismatches cause proof verification failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [Struct: EpochEndingLedgerInfosRequest] [Epoch Overflow] Can start_epoch and end_epoch be set such that they overflow when iterating through epochs, causing the request to wrap around and return incorrect epoch data? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [Struct: EpochEndingLedgerInfosRequest] [Epoch Bounds] Can an attacker set end_epoch < start_epoch to create an invalid epoch range that causes undefined behavior in epoch iteration logic? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [Struct: EpochEndingLedgerInfosRequest] [Future Epoch Request] Can a malicious peer request epoch ending ledger infos for epochs that haven't occurred yet, causing the validator to wait indefinitely and block state sync? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [Struct: EpochEndingLedgerInfosRequest] [Epoch Range Exhaustion] Can setting start_epoch=0 and end_epoch=u64::MAX request all possible epochs, causing memory exhaustion when loading epoch ending ledger infos? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [Struct: EpochEndingLedgerInfosRequest] [Duplicate Epoch Requests] Can an attacker repeatedly request the same epoch range to cause redundant processing and resource exhaustion? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [Struct: NewTransactionsWithProofRequest] [Version Rollback] Can an attacker set known_version to a very old version to force re-syncing of already processed transactions, causing state corruption or replay attacks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [Struct: NewTransactionsWithProofRequest] [Epoch Mismatch] Can known_epoch and known_version be set to inconsistent values (e.g., epoch N with version from epoch M) that bypass epoch boundary validation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [Struct: NewTransactionsWithProofRequest] [Version Overflow] Can known_version be set to u64::MAX to cause overflow when calculating the next version to fetch, resulting in fetching version 0 and creating a reorg? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [Struct: NewTransactionsWithProofRequest] [Event Inclusion Control] Can the include_events boolean be manipulated to exclude events that are required for proper state transition validation, hiding malicious transactions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [Struct: NewTransactionsWithProofRequest] [Future Version Attack] Can an attacker set known_version to a future version that hasn't been committed yet, causing the request to hang indefinitely? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [Struct: NewTransactionsOrOutputsWithProofRequest] [Type Confusion] Can the 'or' semantics allow an attacker to receive outputs when they should receive transactions, bypassing transaction validation logic? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [Struct: NewTransactionsOrOutputsWithProofRequest] [Version Synchronization] Can inconsistent known_version values across different request types cause validators to have divergent state when switching between transaction and output modes? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [Struct: NewTransactionsOrOutputsWithProofRequest] [Epoch Boundary Race] Can requests at epoch boundaries receive a mix of transactions from epoch N and outputs from epoch N+1, causing state inconsistency? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [Struct: NewTransactionsOrOutputsWithProofRequest] [Event Inconsistency] Can include_events being true for transactions but false for outputs create inconsistent event logs that break event-based applications? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [Struct: NewTransactionOutputsWithProofRequest] [Output-Only Validation] Can receiving only outputs without corresponding transactions allow malicious outputs to be accepted without validating transaction signatures or authorization? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [Struct: NewTransactionOutputsWithProofRequest] [Version Consistency] Does known_version for outputs match the version used for transactions, or can version desynchronization cause state divergence between transaction-syncing and output-syncing nodes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [Struct: NewTransactionOutputsWithProofRequest] [Epoch Transition Outputs] Can outputs for epoch-ending transactions be requested separately, potentially bypassing validator set change validations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [Struct: NumberOfStatesRequest] [Version Validation] Can an attacker request the number of states at a version that doesn't exist or hasn't been committed, getting incorrect state count information? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [Struct: NumberOfStatesRequest] [State Count Manipulation] If the number of states is used to calculate chunk sizes or memory allocation, can providing incorrect counts cause buffer overflows or underflows? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [Struct: NumberOfStatesRequest] [Resource Enumeration] Can repeatedly querying different versions to map state growth reveal sensitive information about transaction patterns or account creation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [Struct: SubscribeTransactionsWithProofRequest] [Subscription ID Collision] Can an attacker reuse or guess subscription_stream_id values to hijack or interfere with other nodes' subscription streams? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [Struct: SubscribeTransactionsWithProofRequest] [Stream Index Manipulation] Can subscription_stream_index be manipulated to skip transactions or receive duplicate transactions in subscription streams? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [Struct: SubscribeTransactionsWithProofRequest] [Index Overflow] Can subscription_stream_index overflow after long-running subscriptions, causing the index to wrap around and replay old transactions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/data-streaming-service/src/data_notification.rs] [Struct: SubscribeTransactionsWithProofRequest] [Subscription Replay] Can an attacker restart a subscription with an old known_version and known_epoch to force replaying of historical transactions and cause state rollback? (Critical)
